forumNotes.author: alexproffitt
forumNotes.content:
Hi guys / gals,  

This is my first post to reboot.pro despite having been a reader for a fairly long while.  
I'm currently trying to go about setting up a Windows 7 USB bootable HD for transfer between my home and office PC's.  

I'm not new to booting via USB and have XP on a Maxtor 500GB USB HD, which my other half uses on her work laptop.  

I've spent the last two days trying to make an Iomega Prestige USB2.0/3.0 500GB HD (gifted to me) into a bootable drive and failed.... HARD.  
I've removed the Iomega crapware Virtual CD and lowlevel formatted it using several tools.  
Using bootsect /nt60 F: /mbr - results in bootsect becoming non responsive.  
Grub4Dos / RMPrepUSB / Zero'ing out the MBR all return a variety of errors or "parameter is incorrect" messages.  

I've concluded that maybe this is due to some hidden partition or protection of the MBR due to the supposed hardware AES encryption.  

Is there a list anywhere of USB HD's that are confirmed working as bootable USB devices (I'm aware of the caveats around "bootable" based on BIOS limitations etc)?  

As I've got no where with this device I've persuaded the shop it was bought from to give me an exchange and I'm currently looking at:  

SEAGATE STAA500200 Go Flex Ultra Portable External Hard Drive - 500GB  

Anyone got any experience with this device?  

Thanks,  

Alex

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
hi Alex,   

welcome to reboot!  

I have two older seagate USB free agent GO HDD and they both boot fine but any USB HDD should not have a problem. it is the USB Flash drives (thumbdrives) that can be problematic.  

check out this link and try the pretest to see if it will boot:  

[http://www.usboot.or...nts and Pretest](http://www.usboot.org/tiki-index.php?page=Prearrangements%20and%20Pretest "External link")  

also try it another machine to confirm your results if possible.  

BTW, I have had nothing but success with using dsfok to zero out HDDs when needed to start over from scratch. I learned about it here but the board wont let me look up my older posts but it is a commandline program and allways works for me.

forumNotes.author: alexproffitt
forumNotes.content:
Zoso: I to thought that it should be possible to make any USB HD bootable, as already mentioned I've done it with XP on a 500GB Maxtor drive and had already accomplished Win7 on a Sandisk Cruzer 8GB thumbdrive as a test.  

As per Wonko's suggestion in another thread I tried the tool DSFOK mentioned here: <http://reboot.pro/4015/page__st__21> to try and delete any manufacturer specific bootcode or hidden partitions. The tool seemed unable to write to the disk in those early sectors, can't remember the exact error code now.  
Every tool I tried seemed able to write the bootsector but not the bootcode in the MBR.  

I am assuming that this was due to something relating to the AES Hardware Encryption feature - other than that I draw a blank.  

Un/fortunately, I took the simple option and exchanged the Iomega unit for the Seagate unit mentioned above, which worked flawlessly first time!  

Thanks to both of you for your answers, much appreciated!  

Regards,  

Alex
